result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Damien Montrell Griffin not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are not ready to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Defense is awaiting additional discovery from the State.
Defense requests an adjournment.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 10-27-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Darryl Smith appeared in Court.  Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner appeared as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin NOT in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on Atty. Smith's oral motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
No objections.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Smith to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
**Atty. Darryl Smith is now discharged.
Atty. Kevin Gaertner is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 09-12-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Damien Montrell Griffin not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense is awaiting an offer from the State and needs time to review discovery.
Parties request another Status Conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status Conference.

Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from MSDF for purposes of this hearing. Defendant picked up a new case. Case adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 2. Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Damien Montrell Griffin not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Status Conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-22-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Matte-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Smith in court, defendant Damien Montrell Griffin not in court, in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced from MSDF.  State informs the Court that an Order to Produce had been filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Oral No Contact Order with Syed R and the address of 4057 N. Green Bay Ave., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Damien Montrell Griffin in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
